p: Among the genera, Zingiber had the highest number of use reports from 12 species. The genus Curcuma had the highest number of medicinal species in the family, but with fewer use reports than Zingiber. Seven Kaempferia species provided 117 use reports, and there were 104 use reports from 10 Alpinia species, while the other genera had fewer than 30 use reports ( Table S1).
